ChessProject Documentation

ChessProject.bishoplike — Method
bishoplike(board::Board)

Get the location of all the bishops and queens on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.bishops — Method
bishops(board::Board)

Get the location of all the bishops on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.cancastlekingside — Method
cancastlekingside(board::Board, color::Color)
cancastlekingside(board::Board)

Return a Bool which denotes if the player of color can castle kingside.

ChessProject.cancastlequeenside — Method
cancastlequeenside(board::Board, color::Color)
cancastlequeenside(board::Board)

Return a Bool which denotes if the player of color can castle queenside. If no color is given, it assumes the color of the current turn.

ChessProject.checkers — Method
checkers(board::Board)

Return the Bitboard of all the pieces giving check.

ChessProject.empty — Method
empty(board::Board)

Return the positions, as a Bitboard, of all the empty squares on the board.

ChessProject.enemy — Method
enemies(board::Board)

Return the positions, as a Bitboard, of all the enemies on the board.

ChessProject.friendly — Method
friendly(board::Board)

Return the positions, as a Bitboard, of all the friendly units on the board.

ChessProject.importfen — Method
importfen(fen::String)

Create a Board object from an input FEN, given as a String.

ChessProject.ischeck — Method
ischeck(board::Board)

Returns true if the king is in check, false otherwise.

ChessProject.kings — Method
kings(board::Board)

Get the location of all the kings on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.knights — Method
knights(board::Board)

Get the location of all the knights on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.monkey! — Method
monkey!(board)

The monkey AI plays random moves. It is a monkey.

ChessProject.occupied — Method
occupied(board::Board)

Return the positions, as a Bitboard, of all the occupied squares on the board.

ChessProject.pawns — Method
pawns(board::Board)

Get the location of all the pawns on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.perft — Method
perft(board::Board, depth::Int)

Run the perft routine to a given depth.

ChessProject.pinned — Method
pinned(board::Board)

Return the Bitboard of all the pieces that are pinned.

ChessProject.queens — Method
queens(board::Board)

Get the location of all the queens on the board, as a Bitboard.

rooklike(board::Board)

Get the location of all the rooks and queens on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.rooks — Method
rooks(board::Board)

Get the location of all the rooks on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.Bitboard — Type
Bitboard

The type used to encode the information about the 64 squares into a 64 bit number. Construct an object of type Bitboard by providing a value of type UInt64.

Example

julia> Bitboard(0x00ff00000000ff00)
Bitboard:
8
7 x x x x x x x x
6
5
4
3
2 x x x x x x x x
1
  A B C D E F G H
ChessProject.Board — Type
Board

A DataType representing the state of a chess board.

ChessProject.Color — Type
Color

DataType representing a color.

ChessProject.Magic — Type
Magic

DataType used for storing magic numbers, rook or bishop move masks, and respective shift and offset values for the computation of sliding moves.

ChessProject.Move — Type
Move

DataType used to store the information encoding a move.

ChessProject.Move — Method
Move(move_from::Integer, move_to::Integer, move_flag::Integer)

Encode a move, giving the from & to squares, alongside the promotion flag.

ChessProject.Move — Method
Move(move_from::Integer, move_to::Integer)

Encode a move, giving the from & to squares, assuming no special move flags.

ChessProject.MoveStack — Type
MoveStack

DataType for storing lists of moves.

ChessProject.Piece — Type
Piece

DataType representing a specific piece with type and color.

ChessProject.PieceType — Type
PieceType

DataType representing a type of piece.

ChessProject.Undo — Type
Undo

DataType for storing the minimal amount of information to restore a Board object to its previous position.

ChessProject.UndoStack — Type
UndoStack

DataType for storing lists of Undos.

ChessProject.BLACK — Constant
BLACK

Constant representing black.

ChessProject.WHITE — Constant
WHITE

Constant representing white.

Base.:! — Method
!(color::Color)

Find the opposite color.

Base.:& — Method
&(bb_1::Bitboard, bb_2::Bitboard)
&(bb::Bitboard, sqr::Integer)

The bitwise "and" (intersection) between two Bitboard objects. Also supports the case where one argument is a square of Integer type.

Base.:<< — Method
<<(bb::Bitboard, n::Int)

Shift the bits in the Bitboard object left by an integer n.

Base.:>> — Method
>>(bb::Bitboard, n::Int)

Shift the bits in the Bitboard object right by an integer n.

Base.:| — Method
|(bb_1::Bitboard, bb_2::Bitboard)
|(bb::Bitboard, sqr::Integer)

The bitwise "or" (union) between two Bitboard objects. Also supports the case where one argument is a square of Integer type.

Base.:~ — Method
~(bb::Bitboard)

The bitwise "not" of a Bitboard object. That is, return a Bitboard representing all the squares not in bb.

Base.:⊻ — Method
⊻(bb_1::Bitboard, bb_2::Bitboard)

The bitwise "exclusive or" between two Bitboard objects.

Base.isempty — Method
isempty(bb:Bitboard)

Determines if a given Bitboard contains any active squares

Base.isone — Method
isone(bb::Bitboard)

Returns true if the Bitboard contains only one square.

ChessProject.absearch — Method
absearch()

Naive αβ search. Under development.

ChessProject.add! — Method
add!(board::Board, piece::Piece, bb::Bitboard)
add!(board::Board, piece::Piece, sqr::Integer)

Add a piece to the board square given by an Integer sqr, or a Bitboard bb.

ChessProject.addremove! — Method
addremove!(board::Board, piece::Piece, bb::Bitboard)
addremove!(board::Board, piece::Piece, sqr::Integer)

Remove a piece from the board at the square given by an Integer sqr, or a Bitboard bb, and then add the given piece in its place.

ChessProject.apply_castle! — Method
apply_castle!(board::Board, move::Move)

Apply the given move to the board. Assumes the move has the __KING_CASTLE or __QUEEN_CASTLE flag.

ChessProject.apply_enpass! — Method
apply_enpass!(board::Board, move::Move)

Apply the given move to the board. Assumes the move has the __ENPASS flag.

ChessProject.apply_move! — Method
apply_move!(board::Board, move::Move, undo::Undo)

Apply the given move to the board, adding changes to 'undo'.

ChessProject.apply_normal! — Method
apply_normal!(board::Board, move::Move)

Apply the given move to the board. Assumes the move has either the __NORMAL_MOVE or __DOUBLE_PAWN flags.

ChessProject.apply_promo! — Method
apply_promo!(board::Board, move::Move)

Apply the given move to the board. Assumes the move has the __<PIECE>_PROMO flag, where <PIECE> is either a KNIGHT, BISHOP, ROOK, or QUEEN.

ChessProject.blockers — Method
blockers(sqr_1::Integer, sqr_2::Integer)

Retrieve all the blocking squares between sqr_1 and sqr_2, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.chartopiece — Method
chartopiece(c::Char)

Converts a Char from the FEN to its respective Piece type.

ChessProject.color — Method
color(piece::Piece)

Return the Color type of a given piece.

ChessProject.count — Method
count(bb::Bitboard)

Count the number of filled squares in a Bitboard object.

ChessProject.evaluate — Method
evaluate(board)

Naive evaluation function to get the code development going.

ChessProject.file — Method
file(bb::Bitboard)
file(sqr::Int)

Get the Bitboard representing the file of the given square. Input is given as either an Integer type, or a Bitboard - assuming it contains only one square.

ChessProject.findpins — Method
pins(board::Board)

Retrieves all the pinned pieces on the board, as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.flag — Method
flag(move::Move)

Given a move, return any special flags, as an Integer.

ChessProject.from — Method
from(move::Move)

Given a move, retrieve the "move from" square, as an Integer.

ChessProject.gen_moves! — Method
gen_moves!(movestack::Movestack, board::Board)

Generate all the possible moves in the position.

ChessProject.gen_noisy_moves! — Method
gen_noisy_moves!(movestack::MoveStack, board::Board)

Generate all the noisy moves on a board, pushing each Move to the MoveStack.

ChessProject.gen_quiet_moves! — Method
gen_quiet_moves!(movestack::MoveStack, board::Board)

Generate all the quiet moves on a board, pushing each Move to the MoveStack.

ChessProject.isattacked — Method
isattacked(board::Board, sqr::Integer)

Is the given square attacked?

ChessProject.isdoublecheck — Method
isdoublecheck(board::Board)

Returns true if the king is in check, false otherwise.

ChessProject.ismany — Method
ismany(bb::Bitboard)

Returns true if the Bitboard contains more than one square.

ChessProject.kingAttackers — Method
kingAttackers(board::Board, sqr::Integer)

Find all the attackers of a given square, sqr.

ChessProject.kingMoves — Method
kingMoves(sqr::Integer)

Generate the potential king moves from a square given by sqr, returned as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.knightMoves — Method
knightMoves(sqr::Integer)

Generate the potential knight moves from a square given by sqr, returned as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.makepiece — Method
makepiece(piece::Piece, color::Color)

Return a piece of a given color.

ChessProject.owl! — Method
owl!(board, depth)

The owl looks ahead a move using alpha-beta pruning plus quiescence, alongside a naive evaluation. The owl is wiser than the monkey! Care should be taken in selecting the depth, as too high will take a long time.

ChessProject.pawnAdvances — Method
pawnAdvances(c::Color, sqr::Integer)

Generate the potential pawn pushes from a square given by sqr, from the point of view of the color c. Returned as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.pawnAttacks — Method
pawnAttacks(c::Color, sqr::Integer)

Generate the potential pawn attacks from a square given by sqr, from the point of view of the color c. Returned as a Bitboard.

ChessProject.piece — Method
piece(board::Board, sqr::Integer)

Get the Piece located at a square, sqr.

ChessProject.qsearch — Method
qsearch()

Quiescence search function. Under development.

ChessProject.rank — Method
rank(bb::Bitboard)
rank(sqr::Int)

Get the Bitboard representing the rank of the given square. Input is given as either an Integer type, or a Bitboard - assuming it contains only one square.

ChessProject.remove! — Method
remove!(board::Board, bb::Bitboard)
remove!(board::Board, sqr::Integer)

Remove a piece from the board at the square given by an Integer sqr, or a Bitboard bb.

ChessProject.square — Method
square(bb::Bitboard)

Returns an Int representing the first square contained within a Bitboard.

ChessProject.squareAttackers — Method
squareAttackers(board::Board, sqr::Integer)

Find all the enemy units that attack a given square, sqr.

ChessProject.switchturn! — Method
switchturn(board::Board)

Switches the Color of the side to move on a given Board object.

ChessProject.to — Method
to(move::Move)

Given a move, retrieve the "move to" square, as an Integer.

ChessProject.type — Method
type(piece::Piece)

Return the type of a given piece.

ChessProject.updatecastling! — Method
updatecastling!(board::Board, sqr_from::Integer, sqr_to::Integer)

Update the castling rights of the board, given a move is played from sqr_from to sqr_to.

ChessProject.BISHOP — Constant
BISHOP

Constant representing a bishop.

ChessProject.BISHOP_TABLE — Constant
BISHOP_TABLE

Constant containing precomputed bishop moves for all occupancy configurations.

ChessProject.EMPTY — Constant
EMPTY

A Bitboard constant representing an empty board.

ChessProject.FILE — Constant
FILE

A static vector containing all the Bitboard representations of the files of the board.

ChessProject.FILE_A — Constant
FILE_A

A Bitboard constant representing the A file of a chess board.

ChessProject.FILE_AB — Constant
FILE_AB

A Bitboard constant representing the files A and B together.

A Bitboard constant representing the B file of a chess board.

A Bitboard constant representing the C file of a chess board.

A Bitboard constant representing the E file of a chess board.

A Bitboard constant representing the F file of a chess board.

A Bitboard constant representing the G file of a chess board.

ChessProject.FILE_GH — Constant
FILE_GH

A Bitboard constant representing the files G and H together.

ChessProject.FILE_H — Constant
FILE_H

A Bitboard constant representing the H file of a chess board.

ChessProject.RANK_1 — Constant
RANK_1

A Bitboard constant representing the 1st rank (A1 -> H1) of a chess board.

RANK_12

A Bitboard constant representing the 1st and 2nd ranks of the chess board.
